DataElement.preferredName: Medical Oncology Pathology Based Contraindication Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of medical oncology contraindication based on the pathology report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Oncology Pathology Basis Medical Contraindication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study and treatment of cancers with chemicals, biological products or immunotherapy._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something._A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study and treatment of cancers with chemicals, biological products or immunotherapy.

Concepts.definition: The study and treatment of cancers with chemicals, biological products or immunotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.:Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.
A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Dr. Turkbey P173316 request 11.21.17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
